meanings.definition: The act or process of reconstructing something.
meanings.sent1: The reconstructions of the old bridge took many months to complete.
meanings.sent2: The reconstructions of the ancient ruins amazed the archaeologists.
meanings.sent3: The reconstructions of the Lego castle made it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: Her reconstructions of the crime scene helped solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The detailed reconstructions of the dinosaur skeletons were displayed in the museum.

meanings.definition: A rebuilt or remodeled version of something.
meanings.sent1: The reconstructions of the house after the fire made it even better than before.
meanings.sent2: The reconstructions of the classic car made it look like new.
meanings.sent3: The reconstructions of the cake for the party were a big hit.
meanings.sent4: His reconstructions of the old songs gave them a modern twist.
meanings.sent5: The reconstructions of the robot made it more efficient and powerful.

meanings.definition: The process of analyzing and interpreting historical events based on available evidence.
meanings.sent1: The reconstructions of the ancient battles shed light on the past.
meanings.sent2: The reconstructions of historical documents revealed new insights.
meanings.sent3: The reconstructions of the past events were like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her reconstructions of the historical figures' lives were fascinating.
meanings.sent5: The reconstructions of the timeline helped understand the sequence of events.
